title: Coroner identifies man shot, killed; 5 others injured in Central City shooting
content:
NEW ORLEANS —
One of six people who were shot Sunday night in Central City has died.
Earnest McKnight, 63, was identified Monday in an update from the Orleans Parish Coroner's Office. Additional details about his death were not released.
McKnight was shot when gunfire broke out after 8 p.m. at First and South Derbigny streets, the New Orleans Police Department said Sunday.
New Orleans police found five men and a woman with gunshot wounds. The victims are between the ages of 23 and 63.
A spokesperson for the New Orleans Police Department said Monday that one of the victims suffered a life-threatening gunshot wound to the head, but has not confirmed whether it was McKnight.
The others suffered non-life-threatening injuries.
Police said the victims were taken to different hospitals in private vehicles Sunday night, which made it difficult to determine the exact number of people who were shot.
Detectives are searching for surveillance video and witnesses to determine who is responsible. Police believe that the gunman or gunmen intended to shoot at a specific person and shot several bystanders in the process.
Officials are working to determine whether the shooting is connected to other violence reported over the last past few weeks in Central City.
Detectives have not identified a suspect or suspects. Anyone with information is asked to call Crimestoppers at 504-822-1111.
Stay with WDSU.com as updates are released.
